intro: Nauclea pilosa, commonly known as the hairy nauclea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Nauclea pilosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
